text: Children Without is a 1964 American short documentary film directed by Charles Guggenheim, about a young girl and her brother growing up in the housing projects of Detroit. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Short, losing to another film by Guggenheim, Nine from Little Rock. Children Without was preserved by the Academy Film Archive in 2016. ==See also== *List of American films of 1964 ==References== ==External links== * Category:1964 films Category:1964 documentary films Category:1964 short films Category:American films Category:American documentary films Category:English-language films Category:Films directed by Charles Guggenheim Category:Documentary films about children Category:Films set in Detroit Category:Short documentary films
title: Children Without
